attributes.action: Investigate The Local Stealth Tax Which Is The Cleddau Bridge Vital Road Link.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tolls were designed to pay the £12million cost of the build which was completed in 1975 and should have been payed off years ago.
Now in huge credit
It has recently come to light that the funds collected over the years has been abused and used for 'other' agendas for which it was never planned for.

One Daily return Journey to work and back equates to roughly £375 Per Annum, this represents an increase in local taxation by up to 50% and affects low income families hardest.
Time to end tolls
attributes.background:
The Cleddau Bridge is a vital road link which Which due to its location and geography predominantly serves the local Areas of Pembroke, Milford Haven and the close surrounding areas.
In effect The toll bridge effects Individuals,Business and Working families living in this area the most.

rejection.details:
The Cleddau Bridge is the responsibility of Pembrokeshire County Council.

You can use this page to find out how to contact your local county councillor: 

http://mgenglish.pembrokeshire.gov.uk/mgFindMember.aspx?LLL=0
